PAD_OilComment.synopsis: Players comment the black blood is actually oil and it's coming from inside the building.
PAD_OilComment.how_to_trigger: Pass a perception check near the oil at the Dock warehouse,CTY_Main_A: -172.87, 2.57, -147.85Only triggers after having the quest from the Waveservants who mentioned the black blood.

AD_HostageReactsToWaveservantsBattle.synopsis: A hostage reacts to the fact that a battle took place (maybe there's bodies around, or just general destruction).
AD_HostageReactsToWaveservantsBattle.how_to_trigger: Triggers by the first Gondian hostage to come out of the submersible after the rescue, if the players fought the Waveservants in the basement.All hostages are in the speaker group, so this should cover both male and female, and human, gnome and halfling races.

AD_AllandraLeadsBeastmasterOut.synopsis: Chatter between Allandra and the Beastmaster while they are exiting the basement.Allandra is leading the beastmaster away and later on we find him drowned in the Waterqueen's house.
AD_AllandraLeadsBeastmasterOut.how_to_trigger: Plays if the players choose to hand over the beastmaster to the waveservants.

BeastmasterAfterIronThrone.synopsis: One-liner for the Beastmaster after returning from the Iron Throne.Two possible branches - one plays if the waveservants never ambushed you and the other if they did.
BeastmasterAfterIronThrone.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Beastmaster after coming back from the Iron Throne.

AD_BeastmasterExitsSubmersible.synopsis: The beastmaster says everything is ready and he'll open up the hatch - you can come out when ready.
AD_BeastmasterExitsSubmersible.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically after the players arrive back in the Submersible gameplay interior after returning from the iron throne. Follows after the automatic interactive dialog that plays when you get back.

BeastmasterReward.synopsis: Beastmaster thanks you for saving him and gives you his harpoon as a reward.
BeastmasterReward.how_to_trigger: Starts automatically after defeating the waveservants ambushing you in the warehouse basement. You can trigger it again by talking to the beastmaster for a hasmet branch.

WaveservantsConfrontation.synopsis: The waveservants confront you when they see you come out of  the submersible. The beastmaster might be dead or not at this point, and they would have found his corpse if he's dead as it would be in the basement.They only come if you have spoken to them and they have given you the quest.You can hand over the beastmaster or  refuse and fight the waveservants. If you hand him over, they will reward you after he's dead the same way they would if you report his death before going to the iron throne.If the beastmaster is already dead, they confront you about all the destruction that resulted from the Iron Throne's explosions. Since the beastmaster is dead, they are willing to let you go if you tell them you were there for a good cause.
WaveservantsConfrontation.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically when you return to the Dock warehouse basement after dealing with the Iron Throne, if the players have received the quest about slaying the beastmaster and haven't returned it yet.

Beastmaster.synopsis: The players have a conversation with the 'beastmaster' - an engineer who operates the Submersible. The player can either be sent here by Allandra to kill the beastmaster, or stumble here after following clues from the Steelwatch Foundry and want a way to get to the Iron Throne. They can also stumble upon it first, before getting any clues about it.The beastmaster works for Gortash, operating the submersible to transfer people and items to and from the Iron Throne The beastmaster can be talked into taking the players to the Iron Throne using the submersible. If he's killed instead, players will have other ways of finding the needed information and/or items to use the submersible on their own.The beastmaster should make it clear that he would not step out into the Iron Throne itself.
Beastmaster.how_to_trigger: Talk to the beastmaster located in the Dock Warehouse basement.

WaveservantsReward.synopsis: The reward the player for killing the beastmaster and then leave after the dialog.
WaveservantsReward.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically after the beastmaster is killed in the Dock Warehouse after the waveservants confrontation.

PAD_SubmersibleBroken.synopsis: The players comment that the submersible is now broken and cannot be used.
PAD_SubmersibleBroken.how_to_trigger: Try to use the submersible after returning from the Iron Throne

AD_BeastmasterAfterIronThroneChatter.synopsis: Beastmaster talking to the submersible as if it were a person. The submersible is in a very rough, not operational state after barely escaping the Iron Throne destruction.
AD_BeastmasterAfterIronThroneChatter.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically after returning from the Iron Throne if the beastmaster lives

AD_BeastmasterBeforeIronThroneChatter.synopsis: Beastmaster doing things and talking ot the submersible as if it were a person.
AD_BeastmasterBeforeIronThroneChatter.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically on the beastmaster before going to the Iron Throne.

AD_GCubeLube_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_GCubeLube_0.text: *According to the label, this urn is filled with G-Cube Lubricant. How many gelatinous cubes would have to be rendered down into slippery salve to fill an urn this size?*

PAD_OilComment_0.speaker: Player
PAD_OilComment_0.text: Blood? No - oil. Leading right inside.

AD_AllandraLeadsBeastmasterOut_0.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
AD_AllandraLeadsBeastmasterOut_0.text: Say your prayers, dwarf. If any god listens to you.

AD_AllandraLeadsBeastmasterOut_1.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
AD_AllandraLeadsBeastmasterOut_1.text: Watch your tongue, salty. You never know who's listening.

BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_2.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_2.text: Cap needs all the attention I can spare, for now. But one day, when the world's set back to rights, we ought to strike out together again. See what's out there.
BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_2.context: NodeContext: wistfully thinking of the next adventure - 'Cap' is the submarine they are repairing

BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_3.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_3.text: You were good to stick your neck out for me. Those nutters would've tossed me into the harbour with irons on my feet.

BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_0.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_0.text: I never forget someone who's done me a good turn. Neither does Cap. Thanks, mate.

BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_4.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_4.text: Hoo! What a ride! I won't forget it any time soon - and Cap neither.
BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_4.context: NodeContext: just had a great adventure and is full of the joy of life

BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_1.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_1.text: I might've underestimated you before. Won't do that again. Thanks for the adventure! Ha!
BeastmasterAfterIronThrone_1.context: NodeContext: just had a great adventure and is full of the joy of life

AD_BeastmasterExitsSubmersible_0.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
AD_BeastmasterExitsSubmersible_0.text: All right, we're good to go. Say goodbye to Cap and come up the hatch when you're ready.

BeastmasterReward_0.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
BeastmasterReward_0.text: Take care, mate. And scram, will you?

BeastmasterReward_4.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
BeastmasterReward_4.text: I need a drink, a nap, and a holiday. Thanks to you, I'll live long enough to do all three.

BeastmasterReward_3.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
BeastmasterReward_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands off item under screen

BeastmasterReward_1.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
BeastmasterReward_1.text: Now - get all these folks out of here before you get me into even more trouble.

WaveservantsConfrontation_11.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_11.text: There you are! Conspirators with the Abomination. Do you know the harbour is sickened with blood so black the sea itself chokes?

WaveservantsConfrontation_25.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
WaveservantsConfrontation_25.text: Gods! They're nuts. You have to help me.

WaveservantsConfrontation_1.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_1.text: Step out of the way. Protect him and Umberlee will swallow you whole.

WaveservantsConfrontation_17.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
WaveservantsConfrontation_17.text: What?! Mate - you've got to be kidding.

WaveservantsConfrontation_18.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_18.text: Come quietly. The Sea Queen will judge you.

WaveservantsConfrontation_23.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
WaveservantsConfrontation_23.text: I surrender, all right? You wouldn't hurt a harmless man, right? And you, thanks for nothing, prick.
WaveservantsConfrontation_23.context: NodeContext: Last line is directed to the player.

WaveservantsConfrontation_3.speaker: Player
WaveservantsConfrontation_3.text: I won't let you execute this man.

WaveservantsConfrontation_8.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_8.text: Then you've made your choice. You supplicate to the ocean or you are sucked down, down, down.

WaveservantsConfrontation_21.speaker: Player
WaveservantsConfrontation_21.text: You don't understand. He wasn't responsible for the destruction in the harbour.

WaveservantsConfrontation_2.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_2.text: Your lies won't save you. Give us the Abomination or be counted as his ally.

WaveservantsConfrontation_7.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_7.text: Step out of the way, and hand over the master of the beast. Or Umberlee will swallow you whole.

WaveservantsConfrontation_16.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_16.text: You. You were to administer Umberlee's justice! Instead you conspire with the Abomination? He who sickened the harbour with blood so black the sea itself chokes?

WaveservantsConfrontation_19.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_19.text: The bay is tainted with black blood. The Wavemother's citizens wither and choke.

WaveservantsConfrontation_27.speaker: Player
WaveservantsConfrontation_27.text: I was trying to save hostages from an underwater prison. But I failed. They're all dead.

WaveservantsConfrontation_6.speaker: Player
WaveservantsConfrontation_6.text: I saved these hostages from an underwater prison. No harm to the sea was intended.

WaveservantsConfrontation_14.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_14.text: So often the Wavemother pays the price for the sins of men.

WaveservantsConfrontation_26.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_26.text: But you killed the beast's master. You've earned this.

WaveservantsConfrontation_9.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_9.text: There is nothing left for us here, sisters.

WaveservantsConfrontation_4.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_4.text: The restoration of the harbour will take a long time. Black blood clings and stinks like death itself.

WaveservantsConfrontation_12.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_12.text: With the Bitch Queen's blessings, we take our leave.

WaveservantsConfrontation_20.speaker: Player
WaveservantsConfrontation_20.text: Yes - the Iron Throne is gone because of me. It will taint your waters no longer.

WaveservantsConfrontation_28.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsConfrontation_28.text: Indeed. We all of us answer to the Sea herself, whether we know it or not.

Beastmaster_2.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_2.text: Don't get your grubby paws all over Cap. What do you want?

Beastmaster_58.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_58.text: Didn't I tell you to feck off?

Beastmaster_88.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_88.text: Gortash doesn't mess around. If you're fool enough to go back, I'll be fool enough to take you. Just jump in.

Beastmaster_118.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_118.text: Oi, what's this? You ain't supposed to be down here, mate.

Beastmaster_107.speaker: Narrator
Beastmaster_107.text: *A submersible - it matches the description of the vehicle that brought the Gondian hostages into the Iron Throne.*

Beastmaster_69.speaker: Wyll
Beastmaster_69.text: I am here for Duke Ulder Ravengard. Show me the way!

Beastmaster_54.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_54.text: The duke? I mean, if you see him, let him know I'm down for a drink, but he ain't here.

Beastmaster_159.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_159.text: Which begs the question, what are you bloody doing down here?

Beastmaster_77.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_77.text: The only port in this whole bleedin' city that matters. Now why are you here? Did Gortash send you?

Beastmaster_85.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_85.text: That submersible - why is it here? What is this place?

Beastmaster_192.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_192.text: Boss sent me to check up on the situation down here.

Beastmaster_80.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_80.text: Boss sent me to check up on the situation down here.

Beastmaster_61.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_61.text: No news is good news, right? Especially with the rough water between here and the Iron Throne.

Beastmaster_81.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_81.text: No prisoners lost in the last batch of runs, either, though them servants of Umberlee are making the trip damn near deadly.

Beastmaster_200.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_200.text: Bloody salties are always flopping around in the water - I've almost hit one or two now. Might've even nicked one off the port bow the other day.

Beastmaster_120.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_120.text: Maybe that'll teach 'em to keep out the way.

Beastmaster_184.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_184.text: The Iron Throne? That's just the place I need. What do you know?

Beastmaster_60.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_60.text: I've never heard of this Iron Throne.

Beastmaster_74.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_74.text: I need to get to the Iron Throne.

Beastmaster_180.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_180.text: Do you, now? Boss never sends anyone that-a-way but prisoners.

Beastmaster_104.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_104.text: I'm meant to go. Trust me.

Beastmaster_71.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_71.text: All right, all right, keep that mad dog stare to yourself.

Beastmaster_14.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_14.text: I'll take you in. But look - there's some bad shit going down in there. You don't want to get involved. Neither did I, but it was them or me.

Beastmaster_202.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_202.text: I'll get Cap warmed up. Get in when you're ready.

Beastmaster_49.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_49.text: You're meant to go to the Iron Throne, and I'm the King of the Sword Coast.

Beastmaster_50.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_50.text: Don't know what your game is, but I don't want to be involved. Bye.

Beastmaster_199.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_199.text: Please. There's something I need to do in the Throne - something Lord Gortash doesn't need to know about.

Beastmaster_188.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_188.text: Ooh, the jableedas on you. Look, I don't want any trouble - but I know old Gortash is up to some mad shit in there.
Beastmaster_188.context: NodeContext: juh-BLEED-uh. local word for nuts

Beastmaster_36.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_36.text: You must take me for a fool. I ain't going against Gortash for the likes of you. No way.

Beastmaster_190.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_190.text: Feck off while you still can.

Beastmaster_177.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_177.text: Don't know what to tell you. He sent me ahead and said your payment would follow.

Beastmaster_117.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_117.text: Huh. Not like him to surprise me. But - mad times.

Beastmaster_125.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_125.text: Sure he did, buddy. Sure he did.

Beastmaster_3.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_3.text: Boss doesn't need to know - and I'll make your discretion worth your while. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_5_8860ed48-ba5f-4b7b-82bf-f1220f967d41])

Beastmaster_193.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_193.text: Well. Now you're speaking my language.

Beastmaster_46.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_46.text: I know the followers of Umberlee want you dead. Take me there now, and I won't lead them to you.

Beastmaster_191.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_191.text: Gondians, mostly. Collateral to keep those working in the Steel Watch Foundry under control.

Beastmaster_131.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_131.text: You killed one of those servants of Umberlee. Now they want you dead.

Beastmaster_59.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_59.text: Oh yeah? And are you here to make good on that?

Beastmaster_203.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_203.text: Depends. Tell me everything you know about the Iron Throne.

Beastmaster_41.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_41.text: It's an underwater prison - most secure in the Realms. Myself and Cap are the only ones who can make it there in one piece.

Beastmaster_87.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_87.text: Lord Gortash keeps some Gondians there. Collateral to keep those working in the Steel Watch Foundry under control.

Beastmaster_207.speaker: Wyll
Beastmaster_207.text: Ulder Ravengard is here - he must be.

Beastmaster_150.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_150.text: If he is, that's Lord Gortash's business - I don't ask questions.

Beastmaster_51.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_51.text: If you take me to the Iron Throne, I could 'forget' I saw you.

Beastmaster_68.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_68.text: I'll make you a deal - take me to the Iron Throne, and I'll protect you from Umberlee's servants.

Beastmaster_133.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_133.text: You're going to take me to the Iron Throne - I'm getting the prisoners out.

Beastmaster_20.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_20.text: You're as guilty as the people who imprisoned the Gondians.

Beastmaster_205.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_205.text: And you're the judge, jury, and executioner, is that it? Yeah right. Say goodbye, kid.

Beastmaster_140.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_140.text: You killed someone. You need to face justice.

Beastmaster_6.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_6.text: Right. Well you can tell Lord Gortash all's well. Water's real rough between here and the Iron Throne, but we're making it work.

Beastmaster_110.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_110.text: Now, I know you're nothing but a grifter. Spill it - what are you after?

Beastmaster_148.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_148.text: I need to go to the Iron Throne - and I'm willing to pay. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Beastmaster_70.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_70.text: I just want to know what happens in this port.

Beastmaster_189.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_189.text: Nothing without Lord Gortash's go-ahead. I transport whoever he needs taken to the Iron Throne.

Beastmaster_25.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_25.text: It's an underwater prison - most secure in the Realms.

Beastmaster_16.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_16.text: Orin the Red - what do you take me for?

Beastmaster_42.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_42.text: Ha! An absolute chancer. Spill it - what are you really after?

Beastmaster_18.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_18.text: Haven't you heard? I'm the new waterway inspector!

Beastmaster_35.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_35.text: No one tells me anything. Last I heard Lord Gortash handles this port's inspections personally.

Beastmaster_174.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_174.text: Anyway, if you're in charge of the waterways, you got a lot of work to do. Those Umberlee servants are making the trip to the Iron Throne damn near deadly.

Beastmaster_127.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_127.text: What goes on in the Iron Throne?

Beastmaster_152.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_152.text: As it happens, I'll be needing a ride to the Iron Throne. As part of my inspection.

Beastmaster_178.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_178.text: You're a waterway inspector, and I'm Sarevok's last son. What are you really doing here?

Beastmaster_38.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_38.text: I'm the new municipal waterway inspector under Lord Gortash.

Beastmaster_121.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_121.text: I ask the questions. Now talk.

Beastmaster_7.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_7.text: I have questions. You have answers.

Beastmaster_158.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_158.text: Let me guess. This is about them Umberlee servants.

Beastmaster_44.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_44.text: You tell them to stay out of the way. Cap needs the right-of-way - he can't stop on a dime when they go darting in front of the prow.

Beastmaster_91.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_91.text: What do you mean about Umberlee's servants getting in your way?

Beastmaster_13.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_13.text: This big boy - the Captain of Grey Harbour. Built him with my own two hands. Can take the passage between here and the Iron Throne faster than you can say 'fuck the Absolute'.
Beastmaster_13.context: NodeContext: Gestures below him, to the submersible under his feet.

Beastmaster_155.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_155.text: What goes on at this port?

Beastmaster_112.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_112.text: Nothing without Lord Gortash's go-ahead. I transport whoever he needs taken to the Iron Throne. Prisoners, mostly. But that's his business.

Beastmaster_197.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_197.text: The Iron Throne? That's just the place I need. What do you know?

Beastmaster_106.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_106.text: I've never heard of the Iron Throne.

Beastmaster_138.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_138.text: It seems you and 'Cap' killed a servant of Umberlee on one of your latest runs. Now they want you dead.

Beastmaster_17.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_17.text: Uh-huh. Why don't you stop the bluster and tell me what you actually want?

Beastmaster_86.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_86.text: I'm looking for some hostages. Brought into the Iron Throne by an underwater passage.

Beastmaster_134.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_134.text: Well. Me and Cap don't know a thing about that.

Beastmaster_179.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_179.text: This big boy - the Captain of Grey Harbour. Built him with my own two hands. And like I said - we can't help you.

Beastmaster_186.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_186.text: Take me to the Iron Throne, and I won't blame you for your involvement.

Beastmaster_195.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_195.text: Listen, I just do what I'm told. All right?

Beastmaster_89.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_89.text: I don't know who you are, but I know a bluff when I see one. Get lost.

Beastmaster_114.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_114.text: Please. Those people are in real danger.

Beastmaster_165.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_165.text: Look. I don't want anyone to get hurt. But I've got to do what I've got to do, same as anyone.

Beastmaster_170.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_170.text: Wake up, chief. We're all in danger these days. I ain't risking my neck for anyone but me.

Beastmaster_9.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_9.text: I'm here for Duke Ulder Ravengard. Take me to him.

Beastmaster_45.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_45.text: I know you hid hostages. Is Ravengard among them?

Beastmaster_15.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_15.text: Sorry, I just got turned around.

Beastmaster_111.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_111.text: Like I've never heard that one before. Get lost.

Beastmaster_196.speaker: Narrator
Beastmaster_196.text: *You spot a curious metal contraption in the water - a submersible.*

Beastmaster_24.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_24.text: Take me to the Iron Throne. I'm willing to pay. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Beastmaster_139.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_139.text: Take me to the Iron Throne now.

Beastmaster_116.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
Beastmaster_116.text: Get out of my feckin' face with that.

Beastmaster_143.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_143.text: You mentioned Cap - who did you mean again?

Beastmaster_93.speaker: Player
Beastmaster_93.text: What exactly goes on at this port?

WaveservantsReward_0.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsReward_0.text: The Abomination is dead. We thank you for your help.

WaveservantsReward_2.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsReward_2.text: The Wavemother rewards those who submit to her will.

WaveservantsReward_1.speaker: Flood Tide Allandra Grey
WaveservantsReward_1.text: Now - our harbour is filthy with black blood. It clings to life like death. Waveservants - away.

PAD_SubmersibleBroken_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SubmersibleBroken_0.text: Submersible's broken. Can't seem to turn it on.

AD_BeastmasterAfterIronThroneChatter_0.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
AD_BeastmasterAfterIronThroneChatter_0.text: What a ride, eh Cap? You were magnificent.

AD_BeastmasterAfterIronThroneChatter_1.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
AD_BeastmasterAfterIronThroneChatter_1.text: Don't you worry. We'll set you to rights.

AD_BeastmasterAfterIronThroneChatter_3.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
AD_BeastmasterAfterIronThroneChatter_3.text: They'll be telling stories about us, you'll see. 'The Two Captains'.

AD_BeastmasterBeforeIronThroneChatter_1.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
AD_BeastmasterBeforeIronThroneChatter_1.text: After this, Cap, we're taking to open water. Just you, me, and the sharks.

AD_BeastmasterBeforeIronThroneChatter_3.speaker: Redhammer the Deviser
AD_BeastmasterBeforeIronThroneChatter_3.text: And no waveservants, at those depths.
